verses.verse: A Psalm of David<WH1732>. The LORD<WH3068> is my light<WH216> and my salvation<WH3468>; whom shall I fear<WH3372>? the LORD<WH3068> is the strength<WH4581> of my life<WH2416>; of whom shall I be afraid<WH6342>?
When the wicked<WH7489>, even mine enemies<WH6862> and my foes<WH341>, came<WH7126> upon me to eat up<WH398> my flesh<WH1320>, they stumbled<WH3782> and fell<WH5307>. came: Heb. approached against me
Though an host<WH4264> should encamp<WH2583> against me, my heart<WH3820> shall not fear<WH3372>: though war<WH4421> should rise<WH6965> against me, in this will I be confident<WH982>.

One<WH259> thing have I desired<WH7592> of the LORD<WH3068>, that will I seek<WH1245> after; that I may dwell<WH3427> in the house<WH1004> of the LORD<WH3068> all the days<WH3117> of my life<WH2416>, to behold<WH2372> the beauty<WH5278> of the LORD<WH3068>, and to enquire<WH1239> in his temple<WH1964>. the beauty: or, the delight

For in the time<WH3117> of trouble<WH7451> he shall hide<WH6845> me in his pavilion<WH5520>: in the secret<WH5643> of his tabernacle<WH168> shall he hide<WH5641> me; he shall set me up<WH7311> upon a rock<WH6697>.

And now shall mine head<WH7218> be lifted up<WH7311> above mine enemies<WH341> round about<WH5439> me: therefore will I offer<WH2076> in his tabernacle<WH168> sacrifices<WH2077> of joy<WH8643>; I will sing<WH7891>, yea, I will sing praises<WH2167> unto the LORD<WH3068>. joy: Heb. shouting
Hear<WH8085>, O LORD<WH3068>, when I cry<WH7121> with my voice<WH6963>: have mercy<WH2603> also upon me, and answer<WH6030> me.

When thou saidst, Seek<WH1245> ye my face<WH6440>; my heart<WH3820> said<WH559> unto thee, Thy face<WH6440>, LORD<WH3068>, will I seek<WH1245>. When: or, My heart said unto thee, Let my face seek thy face, etc

Hide<WH5641> not thy face<WH6440> far from me; put<WH5186> not thy servant<WH5650> away<WH5186> in anger<WH639>: thou hast been my help<WH5833>; leave<WH5203> me not, neither forsake<WH5800> me, O God<WH430> of my salvation<WH3468>.
When my father<WH1> and my mother<WH517> forsake<WH5800> me, then the LORD<WH3068> will take me up<WH622>. take: Heb. gather me

Teach<WH3384> me thy way<WH1870>, O LORD<WH3068>, and lead<WH5148> me in a plain<WH4334> path<WH734>, because of mine enemies<WH8324>. a plain: Heb. a way of plainness mine: Heb. those which observe me
Deliver<WH5414> me not over unto the will<WH5315> of mine enemies<WH6862>: for false<WH8267> witnesses<WH5707> are risen up<WH6965> against me, and such as breathe out<WH3307> cruelty<WH2555>.
I had fainted, unless<WH3884> I had believed<WH539> to see<WH7200> the goodness<WH2898> of the LORD<WH3068> in the land<WH776> of the living<WH2416>.
Wait<WH6960> on the LORD<WH3068>: be of good courage<WH2388>, and he shall strengthen<WH553> thine heart<WH3820>: wait<WH6960>, I say, on the LORD<WH3068>.
